T3BMemTQ_2WIeq6F9tOLQA.text: I do like Burger & Lobster and find it to be a decent deal (dude don't get the burger, seriously who goes to a lobster joint and orders a burger. shameful).  Lobster or lobster roll wise, the lobster itself is a better deal but you do need to do more work for it (essentially claws/legs as the body is already split open for you).  I do like the lobster roll and usually go for this even though it doesn't have as much meat as the lobster.. but they could definitely american-ize it a bit more.  B&L listen up!#1 don't use so much bread if you are only going to fill up the top 1/2, you are just screaming to be called out as cheap for it. I should have taken the picture of this, it was a bit ridic.2. Butter and grill your bun if you're going to call yourself american style for all that's holy3. Offer if the guest wants it plain, mayonnaise or lightly buttered.  Don't assume we all want your "special" mayonnaise4. Sort out reservations, if I could actually make a decent reservation and have a table for within a reasonable amount of time to rocking up, I'd rock up a whole lot more.Otherwise thanks for the reasonably priced (well for UK here..) lobster! You're a life saver.

S0lfvV2g1aP7tLplEtz8gQ.text: Bad choice for anyone who does not like Burgers or Lobster.  This makes their clientele a small select group, tried it twice and as a vegetarian I found it boring and unaccommodating....

WE7BZlnfaGS6YBmzUkekjw.text: My favourite burger and lobster branch in London! Great service,  nice little bar to wait at if there aren't any tables,  great location,  nice and big inside. Just love it! It's really good value for money and the staff are just wonderful. The chef even gave me a free cheesecake! Highly recommended for a drinks and dining with friends

RoIstbk8VYBasd5AYDpobg.text: 20 for lobster roll, lobster, or burger - comes with side of fries, small salad, and amazing buttery sauce!  for the price it's definitely worth it!  I am a big fan of the lobster roll - you get a significant amount of lobster roll on delicious brioche bun.  -1 star because they guy came, threw dirty napkins on my lobster roll, and tried to take my plate before i finished!  so sad there was still 1/4 of my lobster left!!

NRT1gTP7Wago4KoaU1fuxA.text: All I can say is that this place filled my stomach with extreme pleasure! The lobster was superb and fries were pretty good as well!Also, during weekend this place is much less crowded than in Soho and it's likely you can get seated very quickly. The lobsters are of the same quality in both locations btw.

hDpDAytu_FJKzyPWOO-zCw.text: Can't really say much more than the other reviews. 3 things on the menu - obviously go for the lobster as it's best value for money! Beyond the food, I think the service is pretty great here. Considering they have big queues at no point did I feel rushed to finish and leave. Indeed, after finishing our lobsters we were there for about another half an hour finishing our drinks and no one came over to hurry us!

H8LkMqpJfSbgn0_aorF1ng.text: Very meaty  sandwich with loads of lobster. Super fast service. Worth the price. Great meal, overall!

ArNNCCk8G8bax4-gw8xHkA.text: A solid spot. I'd had the lobster before (at the Soho location) so opted for the burger this go round. I normally wouldn't spring for a £20 burger (a man must have principles) but since somebody else was buying I went for it. (It is worth noting that the burger, whose patty is substantial, also comes with a salad and chips, so that £20 figure does include some extra gear.) It was a damn tasty burger, though a bit busy and unwieldy; there's something to be said for a burger marked by its simplcity and economy, rather than complexity and size (the Lobster & Burger burger takes those latter descriptors). Still, when you put beef, cheese, bacon and bread together its hard to go too wrong, and this burger was mostly right. The ambiance is pleasant and the service attentive and friendly. Worth a visit.

qgcjVqK3YlX0EbhiQkfdSg.text: The restaurant name says it all. There are only three things on the menu but it's all enough to make your tummy scream for goodness. The lobster is fresh and juicy. If you try the lobster roll, the lobster bits make you want to try the full baked lobster. Fries on the side are lightly salted and they make you crave for more. It also comes with a nice bowl of salad. Totally recommended for seafood lovers.

L3PAR0vKstNlDek_zJ1ePA.text: Fabulous!!! I've been hearing rave reviews of this place for a year, yet still hadn't managed to make it until this past monday night. I went to the one in the City, as I work right next to it. My girlfriend and I went for an early dinner, and as it was a Monday it was fairly empty. The waitstaff were incredibly friendly, helpful and attentive. The seats were very comfortable, and the whole place was terribly clean and cosy. My friend chose the steamed lobster, and I chose the lobster roll. Everything came with chips and salad. The salad was wonderful, I really liked it, and the chips were good, but not great. The lobster looked fabulous, and my lobster roll was DELICIOUS, though perhaps a bit too lemony if that's possible. We both enjoyed the house white wine, which wasn't bad. £20 for the lobster is excellent value, and even for the lobster roll not bad. I'm not sure who would visit a place that serves lobster at that price and order a burger, but to each his own... There was also a vast menu of cocktails designed to match your food, which looked delicious, however I am a wine lover so stuck to the wine. This being the City branch, it had a definite 'City boys' atmosphere. It felt like the kind of place business deals would be made, with a rich mahogany and deep red interior. I'm curious to see what the interiors of the other branches are like.I will definitely be back!

J7AA0VRJWQTN6Mxq5irQ0A.text: The food is good, however a bit too expensive for what it is. We only had lobster (the grilled one and the brioche one). Sauces are delicious. Fries very standard, nothing special about them. Service is average, it seems they are a bit tired of explaining the customers how the menu works. I recommend it for one-time experience only, wouldn't go back for a round two.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The brioche lobster sandwich with not-so-special chips and salad.

dhOqirCfDZbKtdmPMVmMLg.text: If you are like me and hate having to choose from a million things on a menu, this is your dream place!Three options: lobster, lobster roll or burger. I've had the two lobster options before and they are simply scrummy. I don't think there was more than 10mins between ordering and eating. For £20 you get lobster and chips and a mouth watering sauce to go with it. They don't provide quite enough sauce but staff are friendly and will bring more if needed.The vibe is nice with soft lighting and background music etc.Yeah, definitely worth returning to this place esp when there's no queue! Also I spotted a famous celeb chef and their friends there last time so clearly perfect for all tastes....

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom

-t0D7VnaSQTSKRIVJs6qjw.text: What can I say that hasn't already!?!.... Burger Lobster is a great choice for anyone wanting casual and flashy all at once. We came mid week at just before 1800, and were immediately seated.The menu is in the name.. Burger or lobster (lobster roll also an option) I've tried both the burger and the lobster (steamed) the burger was "ok" not the best, and add in its £20 and it becomes even less appealing. The lobster was actually really good (I say this as I'm not a regular lobster eater, I see them as overly complicated giant prawns) they have done all the hard work in breaking it up into easily manageable sections and provide the tools to ensure you maximise the meat, the more experienced lobster eater will probably get loads more off the carcass but even I left feeling I'd done a reasonable job. Each choice comes with fries, salad and a garlic butter sauce..... Both sufficient, I don't think you go here to comment on the sides.The place has a cool vibe and is pretty open with lots of seating without being on top of each other. The drinks menu is good with a decent wine selection and I didn't think the prices were too bad.The staff seem to enjoy being there and were friendly and accommodating, I got the idea they may struggle if the place was busy... But it wasn't so I can't be sure.Anyone that comes to London and in need of a "safe bet" should put this place high on the list.

FfLkZzuRqgy2qCuCjOyWXA.text: I love Burger and Lobster, and I love taking my family there because it's such a simple concept, it's faultless and also it means I get props from the parentals and I hardly ever get that and I should probably see a therapist about this.This has been the quickest burger and lobster dinner ever because although it was in the city and I was full on expecting it to be packed with banker clientele after work, it wasn't and we got seated straightaway, which was brilliant for me as I was taking out my grandma and mother who, for lack of better words, hard to impress. They don't queue. They're very surburban.Anyways the friendly wait staff explained and took our orders. My brother ordered a pineapple cocktail which was really tasty, and I had a glass of prosecco, on a wednesday. I know, how naughty! I wasn't even celebrating! We ordered 3 steamed lobsters and 1 grilled, with garlic butter which apparently, is the sauce of gods, because we ordered another garlic butter on top of what we ordered. (roll us out why don't you!) The lobster was steamed perfectly on mine, my mum's was a tad overdone but by a minute or so, it wasn't obvious. The bill came to a very reasonable £113 with service.Top service, top food. I'll be back.

qP6M-8ou5lRYRrRiQVkYeg.text: Damn. Burger & Lobster is stunning. From being seated to leaving I was left delighted.As you're seated, the waiters helpfully explain how the process works. It's a simple process. You choose either Lobster, Lobster/Roll or Beef Burger. If you're here for the beef burger, just leave. This isn't the place for you. For the others, you can choose from steamed or grilled lobster. Apparently steamed in nicer, whereas grilled is sometimes dry and burned hindering the flavour. I opted for the steamed lobster with garlic butter sauce. OH MY.The crab claw meat once plucked out of the claw using the lobster tools (no idea the proper name for these) then dipped in the garlic butter is truly divine. I've had many types of crab, lobster burger, crawfish (errgh) but never a whole lobster before. It's just out of this world in terms of the delicate white meat flavour against the salted garlic. Served with Salad and really nice crispy fries for £20, it's almost unbelievable. Sure these aren't the biggest lobsters you'll ever set eyes on, but when you add in the location, service, decor etc...it's superb value. B&L is a real showcase for how the right process and simplicity of menu can reap dividends. The desserts were baked cheesecake topped with oreos or Eton mess. They were nice, served in paper cups like we'd ordered a takeaway dessert from a cookie company, or similar to Snog dessert shop. No complaints though, if this is what it takes to deliver me a £20 lobster, I'm game..In all, I loved the experience. The staff were unpretentious despite the look and decor of the venue, and it's as casual as you can get. Booking is difficult, and luckily the Bread Street branch allow reservations for a party of up to 8. The downside is that they only have one of these "large" reservations available at each timeslot, so expect to book a table at least 2 weeks in advance if you want dinner at one of the peak dining times, e.g. 7pm.Shall be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Eton Mess and Baked Cheesecake with Oreos
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Steamed Lobster w/ salad, fries and garlic butter sauce

xzVhZumSwZRdclV_lFP0iQ.text: I know £20 for a Burger, Lobster, or Lobster Roll may seem a bit steep. Add an hour wait on top of that and it makes it an even slippier slope, but damn this place makes me happy.I've never been to this location before. I was crossing my fingers that it wouldn't be as busy as its' Soho counterpart, but I was wrong. I was quoted over an hour wait, so my friends and I decided to head to the pub while we waited to be called. I'm pretty sure it was about an hour when they called us back and we got a nice table in the front. We ordered more cocktails and decided which one of the three things we wanted to order. This was my fourth time at B&L, and I've never had a lobster roll all to myself so I decided that the lobster roll would be on my dinner itinerary this night. What I really like about B&L is that they really have the concept of turnover time down. I mean, you wait an hour to get seated, but the food comes out pretty fast. I say within ten minutes you've got your giant platter in front of you. If you wanted to, you could literally be in and out within 30 minutes (from the time you get seated to the time you've fully engulfed your burger/lobster/lobster roll because you've been STARVING after having to wait for an hour to get seated). You may think that £20 is a lot to ask for, but let me suggest that you should bring two friends and try everything. B&L is even nice enough to cut it in thirds for you. Oh yeah, did you also know that the fries and salad are also unlimited? It's not something they outwardly advertise, but now that you're in the know, might as well take advantage and get your £20 worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster Roll

H79m2Wb5_0ufpZCE8eD1sQ.text: This place is amazing. We tried both, the Lobster and the Burger and we are very satisfied :) service was friendly, we did not need to wait any lines to get a table and it wasn't even ten minutes from the order to getting the food!! The menu is simple, as stated in other reviews, you can pretty much have a Lobster (whole), a Lobster roll or a Burger - flat rate of £20. There's also a combo for two which has one burger for each, a Lobster to share and a dessert each. I've seen a blackboard with "jumbos" but haven't figured out what is that... I guess I have to come again to find out! :D Oh, and the fact that they have hand cream in the bathroom makes it a 4*+!Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The inside

3Gd8-2GlHxUrfW97E5m_mQ.text: Much more quiet branch during the weekend so you wait less for a table. The burger was good and so was the lobster. Surprisingly not sensational but worth the money. Good selection of food and drink. Definitely going there again

9UaUyBJO8LK2BNGqE4nN9w.text: I think Burger & Lobster often divides opinion. First, a caveat, I'm always happy to come here. I think they do a fine lobster, it's always well cooked and broken into manageable bits which I really appreciate. If you're feeling lobster then Burger and Lobster is easily four stars. I just wasn't craving lobsters when my cohort opted to go. I got a grilled lobster and a lobster roll to share - I'm greedy like that. The lobster was delicious as always, the sauce was creamy, salad well seasoned and tasty - for a salad! The chips didn't really impress on this occasion, but they served the purpose of scooping up the sauce. The lobster roll is delicious, just the right amount of mayo in the lobster, a perfectly toasted brioche - it didn't come with a butter dip though! I'm not sure if they've just stopped doing it altogether, but I asked for a butter dip and it was brought forth swiftly.Downsides - there just wasn't enough sauce with the lobster. The pot was less than a third full which was disappointing, I wasn't looking to drown a whole lobster in it, just wanted a bit more sauce is all! As above, the chips weren't great.If you're craving lobster, I can't think of many places that outdo Burger and Lobster for satisfaction and ease of access, the drinks here are solid too. More sauce and better chips would definitely make me a more frequent visitor.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Hello Burger & Lobster
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster with not enough sauce
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. My second mains - the lobster roll

8Wj_LZ8KcBKcmBEDOFesoQ.text: Like I said in my tip its the lobster not the burger you need to try. This is a newer branch to the more popular farringdon branch. Hence why you really see people who work in offices and business around the area winning and dinning or you see those that were unable to get a seat without booking at the farringdon branch dinning here. Regardless of the type of people here what you will find us a less busy quieter branch for the time being at least. Now I've never had a lobster before and I know what a beef burger is about even with or without the bacon slices to add. My seafood experience is limited to salmon and prawns, but boy, when I tried that HUGE grilled lobster it was very much like eating a meaty piece of prawn that you can really sink your teeth into. The claws and shells are a part if the added fun when searching for the remaining pieces of lobster on your plate. I very much enjoyed the pick-fork they gave to hammer down on those difficult shells for my hidden treasures of meat. The accompaniment of chips and salad were good and substantial but nothing really to write home about, but like I said its the lobster you need to be eating here. When my colleges were finished with there burgers they just sat there looking at me enjoying my lobster searching through the shells for more juicy succulent lobster meat, which I was enjoying immensely. The next time I go I am definitely trying a whole lobster to myself as I belief I can do it, I can finish it, I can devour the whole lobster plus my sides of salad and fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. When your done, your done!
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. It's the lobster not the burger you need to try at the burger and lobster.

Ue_cxQxAS19cRigSafFdog.text: So...for a meal before a crazy night in Brixton...my friends wanted to go to Burger & Lobster. Being a n00b I had no idea what I was getting myself into. I mean seriously the menu isn't that extensive...either a burger, a lobster, or a lobster roll. Anyway after waiting for my friends to come (they were late) we finally got seated. We ordered our beverages...I ordered some grapefruit drink. Not really sure what it was called but it was good and non-alcoholic. Now for the food we all ordered the Lobster...I ordered it steamed with garlic butter? and lemon wedges. I realized I only needed the lemon.The lobster came out quite quickly and it was SOOO GOOD. The little salad on the side was also pretty delicious. All in all great meal...and it was what? £20? + drink...I WILL GO BACK...if I have time...

hJPO9vmOgprULYDF5nhO-w.text: This place is fantastic. Great atmosphere, music, service and FOOD!   What a surprise. And it's in NY too.  I found my new fun place.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom

e2OzqWlZhnXAgfYkCDKOFg.text: Very good food. The atmosphere was classy. The service was nice, and they didn't make us beg for more water (like other restaurants in Europe). Our family had one of each entree. The burger was great and juicy. The pickles were sweeter than I'm used to, so they were pretty good. The lobster was very tender. It is also relatively close (20 min walk) from London Tower.The main downside is that all entrees are £20 each, and they greatly incentivise "one dish per person." Prepare your wallets.

Rncrdd6I9MWz26BPx2RjVQ.text: I admit I had quite high expectations for this place after wanting to visit a Burger and Lobster since it first opened in Mayfair but not wanting to brave the queues. I turned up at the City branch around 6:30 and there were plenty of tables but these began to fill up in no time. I had a drink at the bar while I waited for the rest of my party arrive but luckily we were seated within 10 minutes. The staff there were super friendly and attentive. I ordered the grilled lobster with garlic butter and whilst it was very tasty, I felt the chargrilling left a slightly bitter taste  which overpowered the sweetness of the meat. Despite this I'd definitely be up for visiting again to try either the steamed lobster or lobster roll. For £20 I think this is great value for a whole lobster although for a burger I'm not so convinced. Overall Burger & Lobster a simple concept done well and is a must for seafood lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Grilled lobster and chips = happiness

sfsZh5WxYezBSEeJY8Lo2A.text: Easily the best burger in London.  The meat is well seasoned and cooked to order.  Get the grilled lobster and split it in two to share with a friend.Place gets very crowded very quickly, but I was able to dine in the bar area without too much trouble.  Staff was friendly and attentive...the latter is a rarity in Europe.

AUJi-c7oCDGl_WAvuAGYlA.text: 20 pounds - choose your destiny - burger, grilled lobster (not sure if it's whole or half), or lobster roll.  That comes with a tin of chips as you brits say) and a salad with plenty of aged balsamic vinegar on it. You know for London that is a steal.We all chose lobster rolls and none of us regretted it - the bread is sweet and lightly toasted, there's lots of lobster chunks just oozing out, and the sides make the meal more than filling.The industrial space and simple menu makes this an easy spot to eat (provided you can eat burger or lobster).  Drinks menu is pretty extensive and innovative too.  I had this "blueberry milkshake" drink.  A tad too sweet for me, but I thought it would be fun to check out.

1RJ-MvUIG0HmRawJY_dPaw.text: I can't believe it has taken me this long to make it to a Burger and Lobster, though to be fair, I have tried before and just had difficulty getting in when the wait is always so long. Luckily, this time I had plenty of time to kill and waited the requisite 90 minutes for my table, at a nearby pub. The experience of B&L, at first glance, is kind of cheesy. It feels like they're trying to fake a crab shack feel, with the traps on the walls and the exposed light bulbs. Upon deeper examination, it's actually a well designed atmosphere, playful yet classy, and probably the first time "American style" hasn't made me cringe to be associated with it. The food and drinks come out quick here; the drinks also have a particular strength which makes them very enjoyable. I tried two cocktails, the Tom Weller, or something like that, as well as another. I was also hard pressed to not have the Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA which they have on the menu. Any place savvy enough to stock that is good in my book. The food itself was wonderful, so far the best burger I've had in London. The lobster next to me, and the lobster roll across the table, both looked delicious, but I was sold from the word bacon, and never looked back. Crispy, streaky, amazing bacon. Put that on top of a juicy burger with cheddar cheese and the necessary condiments, and I gladly found myself up to the wrists in a whole lotta goodness. The best burgers to me are the ones you can't put down; once you're in, you're committed. The service was nice, the company good. I was truly overfilled and had an amazing meal. The wait, in all senses of the word, was worth it.

TJOvgVRgT8D80MkcMo5eEg.text: So it was my first trip to Burger and Lobster - my cousins had heard rave reviews for it and wanted to check it out while there were in town visiting. I love lobsters and burgers  so I figured I'd become a huge fan of this establishment... I just don't get what all the hoopla about this place is. Lobsters for £20 is decent deal, but for the burger or lobster roll? (The lobster rolls were also pretty small in my opinion, my cousin inhaled his in under 10 minutes). Yes they have decent burgers and lobsters, but they weren't amazing or anything. The place was packed the night we went and I've heard some of the other locations have massive queues... I suppose if you're really craving lobsters then have at it, but for burgers go else where.

-oTB57sRa8_Kooaa1yDmSw.text: I dont sea food in general but the name says its not just a lobster so I decided to give it a try . I was little suprise when I only got a drink menu but then I found why. Only 3 option to choose. Lobster, lobster in bun and cheeseburger. I got the burger and my husband lobster. We both were happy with the food. The only think its king of sad is that lobster is the same price what a burger. Yeah it was very delicious but 20£?Servis was very friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom

7eg36S-S9Fq5YCjS1wE_KQ.text: Hmmm, I wonder what Burger & Lobster sell? This is a place that has really decided to follow the phrase "It's all in the name". The menu is so simple, that there isn't one. You quite simply can order a burger (with optional bacon and cheese), a 1 1/2 lb lobster (either grilled or steamed), and a lobster roll - all for £20.Pretty much everyone I know goes for the lobster or lobster roll, so it was pretty tempting but as I'm on a BurgerQuest, it was always going to be the burger. For £20, you expect to be wowed with a burger or at the very least understand what is supporting the price. Sadly, B&L's burger doesn't quite do that. Don't get me wrong, it's a delicious burger but not worth the price tag. It's a sizeable beast on a soft white bun sandwiching tender juicy meat. The bacon was a great addition with its salty and smoky flavours but I would have preferred  sharper cheddar as the cheese got a bit lost in the mix. You do get unlimited chips and salad (which isn't something they advertise) but whether or not you want them is another question. The chips are perfectly adequate but again they don't really knock your socks off. The salad is great with parmesan cheese and mini croutons so fill your boots with that.Drinks wise, there is decent wine list and some interesting cocktails. I would warn the cocktails are a bit expensive at around £9-10 and fairly light. Wines will run you around £6/glass.Ah, and of course, getting a table. Now the Shoreditch and City locations will let your reserve but the Soho and Mayfair ones typically are walk in only. If you can, reserve a table as otherwise the wait can be anywhere from 20 minutes to 1.5 hours, even on a Tuesday evening. Overall, a good effort at the burger, B&L, but I'm not sure why you need it to be so expensive. Surely you can knock it down to £15 without too much of an issue?

XSUHlq05p7PCXjYKt6TFDA.text: I was unaware that one of these locations was in London. I'd heard about there being one in New York but still have yet to visit NY. Luckily for me there's one in London. After taking the train and a double decker bus and walking what seemed to be forever we finally found the place. As soon as you walked in you could smell the lobster w d my taste buds were amplified times 10. My 3 friends had the lobster roll and fries. I had the lobster and butter with a sauce that was sooooooo good. If this place weren't so far from where we were staying I would've visited once more before leaving. One of my top 2 go to places for food when visiting anywhere near Breadstreet

KNPrLmmIEQ7dcLHOXqSpNw.text: The lobster roll is simply mouth watering and delicious! Even the buttery toasted bun that it comes in is the best bun I've ever had! I got the California Lobster Roll and it was amazing.  Definitely worth every penny... or English pound!  It comes with a side salad and some fries.  We also shared the Chili Lobster that comes with rice.  A bit messy because the shells are on but it's finger licking good!  This location was walking distance from our hotel in St. Paul's area. If only we had an extra day in London I definitely would had visit once more before coming home.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Chili crab
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. California Lobster Roll

wJTcC4L5MDL44UXWa6zr1w.text: This place was so good, I'm dying just thinking about it! My friends and I stumbled upon it when one of them recognized it as a recommendation from one of her friends back home. So, we decided to stop by and give it a try. I mean, who doesn't love burgers and lobster? As soon as we walked in, we could kind of tell it was a little more upscale than we were expecting. However, we were seated right away at a big, comfy booth. The atmosphere of the restaurant was great and our server was really nice. When we opened the menu, we were definitely not expecting the prices... 25 pounds for a lobster roll?! But my friend had heard great things about the restaurant and we all decided it was okay to splurge for some seafood. We all got a lobster roll, except for one of my friends who got a burger. The lobster rolls come with fries, a small side salad, and seasoned melted butter. Everything was DELICIOUS. The lobster roll was definitely the star of the show - it was perfection! The lobster was amazing, especially with the melted butter drizzled over it. And even the roll part was to die for. I don't know what type of bread they use, but we all literally ate every last bite. Those lobster rolls totally left us wanting more. I had to hold myself back from literally stuffing the whole thing into my mouth. My one friend also really enjoyed his burger... Anyways, I'd say besides the price range, this place was awesome. I'd DEFINITELY recommend the lobster rolls to any seafood fans.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll

XVi5CgK3dvS8yx0fxNE_1A.text: In the past, both the burger and the lobster at Burger and Lobster cost £20 each. Unfortunately, times have changed. The former was a rip-off and the latter was a steal, so they've since evened it out at £16 and £27, respectively. Regardless, I've been told that the lobster is still the thing to get here, so that's what I decided on.I thought that the food was standard stuff, to be honest. The lobster itself was quite fresh, but nothing to write home about. It came with a side of salad and chips, which were both pretty ordinary. They do offer a choice of either plain clarified or lemon garlic butter - you know which one to pick.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. 114 Pound Lobster ($27) - wild and live Canadian lobster

b8lAU_gUKhm3DXy570KtLg.text: Probably my favorite restaurant in London!  Loved the chili lobster even though I had the lobster burger sandwich.  The sandwich was really unique but tasted like a burger. The chili lobster was excellent.  Not too spicy but spicy enough for me to enjoy it.  Each meal comes with fries and salad and they even gave us an extra one because they thought we didn't have enough fries in one of them. The service was nice and I will definitely come here again if I had the option too.  Definitely a good lobster place but the burger is not as good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. This is the cover up napkin they give you to not make a mess.

XaMYJyCxYDMvBn6A2_SQiA.text: Yummmm!!!!£20 (before service charge) for a lobster!!! What a bargain!!!My favourite, get a whole lobster, grilled with lemon garlic butter!!! Tyyyuuuummm'n!Dessert is real cheap as well and tasty £5!Coffee just £3!Just go, don't read reviews and ponder. Just go!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom

pcZ6ZSgcMxA204145sxO3Q.text: Great burger, addictive fries, but lobster roll wasn't as good as I would have expected.Shared a burger and a lobster roll. The burger was simply delicious, one of the best I've had in years. Granted, Hong Kong knowingly struggles on the burger scene compared to the US, but being from Boston and NYC I've certainly had better lobster rolls. Oversized roll resulted in multiple bits of just bread and the lobster dressing masked the natural sweetness of the lobster meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll meal
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger meal
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll

_uQdZAdOd73BVWcvGv0GZA.text: Really enjoyed my meal here. Space was large and fairly open. Service was efficient though maybe a bit curt.  Food was great! I got the classic lobster roll - how delicious! Ample lobster and the roll was toasted perfectly. The garlic butter was a nice addition. Fries were perfectly cooked and even the salad was pretty yummy. A great choice for my late lunch/early dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom

FkJJ_PFCq4wYl5wUvZiPNA.text: WORTH.EVERY.PENNY. I got the lobster dog and have dreamed of it every day since. The bun was like the toast of a grilled cheese and the lobster was so fresh. I was getting so full but forced myself to finish because I couldn't get myself to leave even one piece of the deliciousness behind. On top of the amazing meal the atmosphere was very fun. The waiters were energetic and the music was awesome, I even asked what playlist they had on!

HotSj0J0k4VJ1SvlOChTMQ.text: After a long walk from the Tower Bridge, I was happy to find this Burger & Lobster location, which wasn't far from my hotel. I ordered the Lobster Roll and had the Tokyo Dream to drink. The food is as good as it looks...however I took one star off because there was way too much ice in the drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. A tall glass of ice with a splash of a Tokyo Dream...
Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Original Lobster Roll...The best!

jozuE-Vez6pZMbBGvvI9mQ.text: Love love loved it! Came here for my husbands bday celebration and we had such a fun experience and everything tasted amazing. We had the grilled lobster which came with the best crispy fries and a side salad dressed in a vinaigrette. We could not fault a thing! Our waiter was kind to explain the difference between grilled and boiled lobster and then later he saw me struggling with the claws and explained the best way to crack it open :) The lobster tasted amazing and such value for money. I couldn't get enough of the garlic butter sauce. We also ordered a sharing cocktail which was served in a humongous glass... We had quite a few people starring at us at this point, thinking that one of us would down it!I made a reservation via email for my husbands birthday celebration and the customer service was great. I could bring my own celebration cake or they would give a dessert for free! (However at the time of dining, I had forgotten all about the dessert) The atmosphere was great as all the tables were pretty much taken and I loved seeing people being served their dishes. It was my first visit, but definitely not my last!

Z2gD3Suh0zqLVXLd85QbDA.text: Nice simple concept - choose between burger and lobster (and lobster roll). I'd say it's an upscale casual joint with fast service. I thought the steamed pounder lobster was a nice lunch size that didn't leave you hungry or in food-coma. The butter sauce was a bit too strong for my taste though.They did a great job though of cracking open the lobster so there is minimal work here to scoop out the meat.

HSbQMY1dMk0uQ-hmEYwi6Q.text: I'd only been to Burger and Lobster once before and that's when it first open and I have to admit I wasn't blown away.Came back one lunch time when I needed some sustenance to help me recover from the night before and pr fee for the night ahead!  Had the burger with cheese and bacon.  Wow it was really nice.  Very tasty and just enough.  The salad on the plate was a bit wasted, but otherwise it was very nice!Service was just so, and the price was ok!

iAJxfCG72x_WJMsFZqTTtA.text: Lobster rolls are a big deal in my part of the world. After living for years in a barren wasteland, the Great Lobster Roll Invasion of 2012 brought Cousins Maine Lobster, the Lobsta Truck, and other options to our neck of the woods. I quickly determined the best offerings & options, and took it as a given that this was the top of the tank in terms of quality.Flash forward to the present: I had just finished my latest museum excursion in London, and a quick search on Yelp told me that Burger & Lobster was in the vicinity. My wife had specifically singled out this establishment as a place we should try, and normally I would wait for her (really), but my hunger prevailed and I got myself a table for a late lunch.I came here for one thing, and that is what I ordered: the Lobster roll with lemon garlic sauce. It is prepared differently than what I've had in the States, and I was just a wee bit skeptical at first. However, I can now say with confidence that this is the best I've had, and the fries aren't too shabby, either. Just don't look at the bill too closely.

xQPKUp_-fB71Wnz4oUElLA.text: Pretty solid spot. Have been to a few locations in London and they're all consistent -- good food, ambiance, crowd and service. Have had both the burger and the lobster roll, highly recommend the latter. The toasted roll and side of melted butter are perfect, comes with a side of crispy fries and a small salad for a balance of yum and food groups. Have to give a hat tip to the service as everyone is friendly and super on top of things.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The lobster roll, comes with side salad, fries and a yum butter garnish for dipping/drinking....whatev.

GlrPFnixgmHP0st9LfG2Ig.text: By now, you know the concept: choose burger, lobster, or lobster roll for 20 quid. If you are feeling particularly indulgent - or just ravenous - you can sample half of each plus dessert for 30 quid. As this was a work lunch, I chose not to give into an afternoon food coma and went with the lobster roll. It was served with a small salad, homemade chips, and garlic butter. The lobster meat was plump and very well seasoned with a good mayo and salt balance. The brioche was a tad on the heavier side, however, because it is toasted with butter almost to a fried texture. I had some of the lobster meat by itself to avoid the heaviness. Service is rather slow - it took about 15 minutes just to get our order in.

sVXu93OEcM8tLNLjaLa5jg.text: Simple & WonderfulI came here after a long day of touring in search of some good, simple food, and the more than delivered.  I got a delicious burger with fries that hit the spot. I really want to go back and try their lobster because it looked amazing!If you want a fun place to start your night out or just want some good food, definitely check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom

exz99NjHW0dsH5I_1ySiXQ.text: One of the most delicious meals of my life.Please try the lobster with garlicbutter!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger and Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster with garlic butter

Y1fPwXbrlYzYB_E0RIkwxg.text: It's Lobster and/or Burger, they don't even have a menu :)The burger is good with good meat but way too messy. A full Lettuce leaf at the bottom keeps the bun dry, it doesn't make sense to chop it.Potential 4 stars but need to fix the technicalities and for £20 you can expect better.PS: the guy next to me got a lobster and it looks great.

E07AqLqwo0Us9JWy-YaZRA.text: Excellent every time.  This is a solid choice when looking for a casual yet delish and simple meal.  I've been here on numerous times and to numerous locations and have yet to be disappointed.  The service is quick and friendly.  The menu is simple but we'll delivered.  The wait can sometimes be long for a table,  but there is a decent bar area to wait in.  Ensure all of your party arrives together,  otherwise you won't be seated until they arrive.  I'm already looking forward to my next lobster roll.  The soft buttery roll,  the fresh flavourful lobster and warm crunchy chips keep me coming back for more.  Meal for two with drinks and services will set you back about £65.
